intro: Paraboea doitungensis, commonly known as the Doitung mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in forest understories and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
